Can men and women be merely platonic friends?
 
 If so, under what conditions?
 
 If not, why?
 
 
 Curious as to the thoughts of others...as well as experiences.

Can men and women be merely platonic friends?
 
 If so, under what conditions?
 
 If not, why?
 
 
 Curious as to the thoughts of others...as well as experiences.

 
 I would say yes, but it depends on the situation of those involved. Generally a large age gap helps, as does both parties being in happy monogamous relationships. I have a fair few female friends, and that has become easier since I got married.

It's very possible. As soon as the sexual attraction is somehow dealt with, the relationship can continue.
 
 For an impolite but to-the-point example, try a friendship between a man and a woman that the man considers a good friend, but not attractive looking. It's not hard to imagine how the man could easily find the woman interesting, maybe she plays the same computer games as he does or something, but still would not be sexually attracted to her.
 
 As soon as romantic interest is out of the way, friendship can work.

A platonic friendship is possible between a man and a woman is possible if one or the other is gay.
 
 Find a woman who has the same interests as you, especially the ones that your wife/girlfriend is not interested in.
 Tell your wife that you have a woman friend that has the same interests as you and that you will be occasionally meeting to discuss/indulge in them without her..its not going to happen
 
 If you are both single and neither you or your platonic lady friend are hideous then you will end up having sex together eventually.
 Thats just the way it is...

It's very possible. As soon as the sexual attraction is somehow dealt with, the relationship can continue.
 
 As soon as romantic interest is out of the way, friendship can work.
I would agree with this although it doesn't take into account the feelings of either party's SO, which could be a deal breaker.
 
 IME many women delude themselves in that they believe their male friends are not interested in them "that way" or have no hopes of being there in a moment of weakness. I usually tell the women to make a casual offer of sex and find out the truth. Male response predictable.

From the research I've done it seems that the general consensus is that the 'sex' issue has to be resolved.
 
 You can have 'casual' platonic activity partners where the person of the opposite sex is merely someone you encounter...'American' friends (shallow connections, an associate more than anything).
 
 But, for any real, emotion based friendship, the sexual issue seems to almost always come up.
 
 If both parties are in other relationships, then the tension can be alleviated. Other than the S.O. issues raised above.
 If one (or both) are gay. Not much of an issue.
 If one (or both) has NO sexual interest in the other due to lack of attraction then it's probably not much of an issue.
 Also, if they are able, sometimes formerly romantic relationships can degenerate into a mere platonic friendhship.
 
 But, the question that pops up if both are single and there is some other attraction 'Why aren't you in a relationship then? Esp. if you have so much in common.'
 
 Often, it's the man desiring to be with the female friend...as most men seem to think with their neither regions. But, it can be the other way around too.
 
 I'm just curious as to how others think about and deal with this type of situation.

in my high school years, i had tons of girl friends both romantic ones and platonic ones. i had very few male friends in comparison. of course, i often found my friends to be sexually attractive but i could never see myself dating them for whatever reason. maybe i found them to be more sisterly rather than girlfriendy or something, and that would have been weird. thats why i didnt ask a lot of them out. with some girls, i had a hard time ignoring my urges and eventually had to cave in and ask them out. with other girls, i had absolutely no problem being just friends, even if i found them attractive.
 
 i met my current girlfriend in high school and we were best friends throughout, but there was always sexual tension between us since day one. that may have sparked our romantic relationship after high school and were both glad that we were friends for a long time before dating.

 Moi?????????

LOL.
 
 Actually, the question was based on curiosity spawning from the relationship I have with my BFF...a drop dead gorgeous female...by any heterosexual males standards.
 
 I've known her for about 2 years. I didn't meet her through work or common interests, she kinda just showed up. 
 We primarily fixate on self-awareness issues. We share a LOT of commonality. Personal histories, similar up-bringings, similarities in past relationships, similar ideas about most things (not all). Children of a similar age and dispositions.
 
 From my research, it seems that the 'sex' issue is what often gets in the way. I dismissed her, despite her beauty (which is NOT at the top of my list), as 'boring in bed'...I'm a vanilla-ish activist and gatesman-like person in the local BDSM community. I don't participate. I actually get bored of some things and have an aversion to S&M. Much more like a hetero who supports gay rights. So, yes you fundies out there...I'm EVIL. But, then again, you'd be surprised what some fundies are really into...
 
 But, our friendship is based on same communication styles, honesty and trust. Close to the levels of 'radical honesty.' It's been great.
 Pandora briefly came out of the box when I opened up about my activities...apparently she isn't boring...and our interests are the same.
 Yeaahhh. But, that was dealt with. I'd rather have a friend than 'tap that'. True friends, of any kind, are hard to find.
 
 But, one night, around the time I posted this, SHE propositioned me as we walked under a full moon in a park. She was dealing with some personal issues and we were discussion directions our lives were taking.
 And, yes...I TURNED HER DOWN.
 Whuuu???!!!???
 
 I did so as the friendship is based on trust. And, despite everything, my personal integrity is more valuable to me than getting it on with someone I do love. I have to live with myself in the long run.
 
 And, yes, I'm a reasonably attractive male...and I reject more than my share of female advances.
 
 Although...
 In the end, I do find myself considering her more and more for long term potential. I also think she's doing the same for me now.
 This has mostly to do with the roots of our friendship, communication, honesty, trust and respect.
 So, maybe turning down a one night fling...enhanced the foundations for something more and better later?
 I hadn't thought of it too much until this week.
 But, who wouldn't want to 'marry their Best Friend?'
 
 
 I do tend to have several platonic female friends at this stage in my life. But, most of them degenerated to that state AFTER I...'tapped that' and finding out that we're better off that way. Most of it has to do with 'I'm sick of the drama' that was associated with some of them.
 
 Oh well.

 @Sandycane.
 
 I'm actually a 100% monogamous male and VERY commitment oriented. 
 I don't think with my peen at ALL (although it tries to usurp power at times...but, I forcefully have to beat that sucker down, show him who's the boss...now, is THAT TMI? LOL). 
 I also don't participate in the BDSM community...as said, I'm a 'champion for a cause.' As I mentioned, much like a hetero person championing for gay rights. But, I am active in the community. I tend to be able to easily single out the kinky/pervy people in a normal setting...and direct them towards the community. I'm a facilitator. Also very much a social butterfly. And, I REEK of trust. Probably one of the most trustworthy males around. It's that personal integrity thing coupled with a mentor/paternal/teacher personality.
 
 Currently, I'm voluntarily in a celibate/single phase and have been so for a few months. Mostly with getting my life back in order. But, will probably end it by Oct. 
 
 But, as to the BFF. I've actually had to turn to some other female friends as I can't 'read' her that well. And I am an empath. Unfortunatly, the BFF is a muse. So, I fear some of her mannerisms being un/conscious changes to accomodate me. The chameleon. And, when you encounter a VERY attractive person who is muse-like...yeeeaaahhh. Very confusing for me. More so as I am a long term relationship person and she might not be. 
 There has been a lot of 'signals' that normally I'd interpret as high interest by her but, at times she has shown the opposite too. 
 Sigh. Don't you hate 'mixed signals'?
 
 I figure in a week or so, I'll confront her. I tend to be VERY direct. I believe that after this time, she'll be over part of a hump she's been dealing with for a while...RN schooling. She'll hopefully have a clearer head then.
 
 Thanks for the time.

 The last 'serious' relationship I was in, after 3 months into it, the guy showed his true colors as a narcissistic sociopath. After showing him to the back door with a baseball bat, he continued stalking and harassing me with phone calls and emails for more than a year. Luckily, he was forced to move out of the county and that was the end of it.
 
 Needless to say, I've not been interested in getting involved with anyone else since then. That was 6 years ago...and I've never been happier or more content in my life.
 I guess I should thank him for curing me from thinking I needed a man to depend on to survive. emoticon_xhoho
